Interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.IQueue
Inherited members: ShowHide
Deprecated: ShowHide
com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Interface IQueue

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAssetProvider
    public interface IQueue extends IAssetProvider
    Provides access to the Assets that are queued for downloads. The queue's IAssetProvider implementation provides an ordered list of assets queued for download. The getCursor implementations will also default to sorting on the queues position.
    An instance of the queue can be retrieved through the IAssetManager of Virtuoso.
    See Also:
    IAssetProvider, IAssetManager.getQueue(), Virtuoso.getAssetManager()
      • 003_queue 
        Modifier and Type Interface and Description
        IQueuedAssetPermissionObserver 
        static interface IQueuedAssetPermissionObserver
        Result of permission check on adding Asset to queue.
        Normally, the download engine acquires any necessary download permissions when the item starts downloading.
        static interface IQueuedAssetPermissionObserver
        Result of permission check on adding Asset to queue.
        Normally, the download engine acquires any necessary download permissions when the item starts downloading. The permission check can be changed on the Backplane so the check occurs when the item is queued. This interface reports back on whether the queued Item was granted permission to be downloaded or not.
        See Also:
        IBackplaneSettings.getRequirePermissionWhenQueued()

        addAt 
        abstract void addAt(IAsset aAsset, int aPosition)
        Add an asset to the download queue at a specific position in the queue.
        void addAt(IAsset aAsset, int aPosition)
        Add an asset to the download queue at a specific position in the queue.
        Parameters:
        aAsset - Asset to add to the download queue
        aPosition - Position in the queue at which to insert the asset. All current assets at or above the specified position are demoted one position in the queue. If position<=0, Virtuoso will insert the asset at beginning of queue.
        See Also:
        IAsset

        aPosition - Position in the queue at which to insert the asset. All current assets at or above the specified position are demoted one position in the queue. If position<=0, Virtuoso will insert the asset at beginning of queue.
        aPermObserver - The observer to be notified of the permission check when added.

        flush 
        abstract void flush()
        Remove all assets from the download queue.
        void flush()
        Remove all assets from the download queue.
        If the queue is non-empty, this will result in a notification on the queue's Content Uri or a callback to engineUpdatedQueue of IQueueObserver.
        See Also:
        Observers.IQueueObserver, IAssetProvider.CONTENT_URI()
        move 
        abstract void move(IAsset aAsset, int aNewPosition)
        Move an asset's position in the download queue.
        void move(IAsset aAsset, int aNewPosition)
        Move an asset's position in the download queue.
        Parameters:
        aAsset - Asset to move
        aNewPosition - New position for the asset in the queue. All current assets at or above the specified position are shifted down in the queue. If aNewPosition<=0, Virtuoso will move the asset to the beginning of queue. If aNewPosition> size of queue, Virtuoso will move the asset to the last position.
        See Also:
        IAsset
        move 
        abstract void move(int aId, int aNewPosition)
        Move an asset's position in the download queue.
        void move(int aId, int aNewPosition)
        Move an asset's position in the download queue.
        Parameters:

        aNewPosition - New position for the asset in the queue. All current assets at or above the specified position are shifted down in the queue. If aNewPosition<=0, Virtuoso will move the asset to the beginning of queue. If aNewPosition> size of queue, Virtuoso will move the asset to the last position.
        See Also:
        IIdentifier.getId()

      • 008_assetManipulation 
        Modifier and Type Method and Description
        resetErrors 
        abstract boolean resetErrors(int aId)
        Resets the max error condition on an asset
        The max error condition is met when an asset's error count reaches 3.
        boolean resetErrors(int aId)
        Resets the max error condition on an asset
        The max error condition is met when an asset's error count reaches 3.
        Once Virtuoso reaches the max error condition, it will no longer attempt to download the asset until this method is called.
        This will only reset the error count to zero if the asset has max error condition upon it.
        Parameters:
        aId - The id of the Asset whose error state should be reset
        Returns:
        True if the max error condition was removed
        See Also:
        IIdentifier.getId()

        The Uri used when querying the Content Provider.
        android.net.Uri CONTENT_URI()
        Description copied from interface: IAssetProvider
        The Uri used when querying the Content Provider. This is the Uri used for notifications when content changes.
        Unless otherwise stated this Uri can only be used for querying the Content Provider.
        Returns:

        getCursor 
        abstract android.database.Cursor getCursor()
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        android.database.Cursor getCursor()
        Description copied from interface: IAssetProvider
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        The Cursor will default to retrieving all fields and all rows from the Content provider. The sorting order on the Cursor is determined by the Asset Provider's implementation.
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.
        getCursor 
        abstract android.database.Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        android.database.Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
        Description copied from interface: IAssetProvider
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set. The sorting order on the Cursor is determined by the Asset Provider's implementation.
        Parameters:
        projection - A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns.
        selection - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows.
        selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.
        getCursor 
        abstract android.database.Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs, java.lang.String sort)
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        android.database.Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs, java.lang.String sort)
        Description copied from interface: IAssetProvider
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        Parameters:
        projection - A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns.
        selection - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows.
        selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
        sort - How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.
